reviews.review_msg: My concern with Jeremy is his behaviour. For example, during office hours I asked for help. He asked if I understood the question or not, I told him no, and that I get stuck at this step. He raised his tone and said “you have to be ready to admit that you don't understand before asking for help”. Concerning behaviour from someone so educated

I took math 155 with Luis until Jeremy was put in charge of our class for the latter half of the semester. For pros Id say hes definitely smart and knows his stuff, so learning the linear algebra portion of the class was ok. However, Jeremy is the rudest prof Ive ever seen and would flaunt how easy the class is for him or make fun of students

Jeremy is a really kind and caring professor, however during lectures he often skips through examples and talks really fast. His writing is also difficult to encipher. But he is always accessible after classes for extra help and gives great advice. If you take the class with him I recommend doing all of the extra course notes questions.

Jeremy is a hilarious teacher who loves to go out of his way to do interesting things in class. Jeremy is super organized in his lectures, homework, textbook questions, and review; he gives enough practice to ensure success in the course.

Jeremy is one of the most caring and humble professors I have ever had. He is super organized with his lectures, and gives good amount of homework. He is available outside of class and always willing to help. Midterms and finals are easier then the review packages so if you can do well on review packages you are golden.

Not a good prof at all - zooms through this notes really fast and SKIPS most examples in lecture notes (says they're too hard or too easy). Says there isn't enough time in class for examples, but will spend 10 minutes discussing an inspirational quote?? Don't take calc with him, wait for a better prof to teach it if you can.

Does not teach anything at all. He barely fills in his notes and skips over every single example. How tf are you supposed to learn math if you don't do examples?? Then if he finds example too hard, he skips it, if its easy, he skips it. Horrible prof, just do not take math with him. You have to teach yourself everything, everything.

Jeremy is by far the worst instructor I have ever had. He is so rude & just unaware of what he is teaching. He barely goes through lecture notes & skips EVERYTHING there's literally no point of going to class because HE DOESN'T TEACH. Along with that, he is just so rude! When someone asks a question he gets annoyed. Very rude & horrible at teaching

Once asked how to do a question on a quiz we just took. Gave me the side eye and said "It doesn't matter" wait what? He admits to not understanding the material he teaches, does not speak clearly or writes clearly. Did not learn much in lecture, taught myself calc II. Didn't have office hours until after first midterm. Quizzed material too early.

Jeremy is an intelligent young man with broad knowledge extending beyond just math. He is a natural entertainer and does super fast thinking in his head while teaching. There's truly no dull moment with Jeremy and I will miss him. He leaves us hopeful and inspired in a subject which may seem hard to apply in RL. He's not mean, it's tough love. :)

Very bad handwritten slides/examples. Basically need to learn by yourself. Final exam was okay but overall made the course quite much more difficult than needed to be. Needs to spend more time on examples and less time going off on tangents.

Jeremy is a very nice prof. He gives us samples before midterm and final. These samples are very helpful and very similar to final. Also, each week he gives us homework , these homework is very similar to the quiz, even harder than quiz but it does not matter. If you do all these homework, final exam is very easy!

Go to his office hours, please, if you ever need any help. Jeremy makes this course hard, but he isn't bad at explaining concepts. If you want to ace the exam, you gotta do all of the practice problems he gives you. Also, he doesn't do much examples in class but there are countless examples on the free textbook given and all you gotta do is read.

It's true that Jeremy's exams aren't easy, but almost all of the questions on his exams are covered in the textbook, for example, when I find a question difficult on the exam, I was frustrated, but I found out that the question (along with explanations) was ON THE TEXTBOOK only later. Please read the book A LOT to prepare for Jeremy's exam.

Jeremy makes this class much harder than it needs to be. Even if you study you are not guaranteed to do well on any of the tests. He did a very poor job at explaining concepts and most of the concepts he stressed during lecture were not important when taking the exam . Study IQ's and textbook . Final had an average of 48%, class average was C.
He does not go over examples in class and his exams are very long
Dont take his class
Really bad

It's unfortunate that many people see Jeremy's class as hard. His marking and testing are just as difficult as all my other courses, and he really made me study hard for calc. This is university, we are all gonna learn it from the book with some aid from profs. If you cannot read the ENTIRE sub-chapter in 50 mins, do not expect your prof to do so.

Jeremy isn't a good prof at all. He's not a nice person and doesn't treat students with respect. He says he doesn't have 'time' to go over key concepts in class, if I knew I had to teach the course to myself I would've just taken it online. Also his in-class quizzes are too long and difficult for the 10-min time we get.

course is easy throughout and then he hits us with a debilitating final. Says he doesn't have time to teach key concepts or go through crucial example problems but has all the time to crack jokes for clout?

Jeremy is really really funny. He starts and ends lectures with a throw back song which really helps you wake up. His lectures are mandatory cause his notes aren't the best. You wont really understand them without attending lectures but he makes lectures so fun that you want to go to them. Tests were fair but the marking for the final was rough.

Jeremy is a very funny guy, and is pretty good at explaining things in lecture. BUT his notes are very disorganized and he does not teach with many examples, making homework and studying difficult. The final exam was super long, so be sure to be robotically fast at calculations if you take this class with him.
Makes class fun but he never finishes his examples so it is hard to study from his notes. Final exam is very hard. Got a A in math 154 and C+ in this class. Makes things harder than they need to be

Jeremy might be a young professor, but he really cares about his students. He wants you to succeed, so he makes sure you understand concepts before doing the computation. His IQs can be slightly difficult, but if you go to his office hours, he will definitely help you! I love it when he plays music at the beginning of class! So fun!

Overall ok prof. Midterm was easy but final was EXTREMELY long, not even three hours were enough to finish. Very young professor which makes him relatable but going to class is a necessity since his filled notes online sometimes don't make sense. Generally would recommend him but be prepared for long exams

Jeremy really cares about his students. He showed us a penguin slipping and getting back up meaning that we can always pick ourselves up after bad grades. Midterm was pretty long, but if you know your stuff & watch your time, you'll finish it. Review textbook questions (CNs) and lecture notes, IQs. Midterm was fair and he teaches well. qt3.14indeed

Jeremy is a funny prof who tells jokes that are NOT offensive in any way in class, which makes Math more enjoyable to learn. He can seem a bit scary or condescending,but he's actually not mean. Always go to office hours if you need help, he may say 'you screwed up',but he takes time to make sure you understand. He loves teaching, a qt 3.14

Jeremy takes time to explain concepts to students who don't get it. He constantly asks the class if they follow. Midterms can be a bit long so watch your speed in writing. He posts his empty and filled notes online,but he has detailed verbal explanations in class,his class attendance is actually quite high. Do all hw,and review packages. Nice prof.
best prof hes a qt 3.14. He was very helpful if you went to see him, and his exams are all very fair.

Review concepts taught in class before asking him about hw bc he will be annoyed - which is fair. He's a very clear lecturer and explains foundations well - no he isnt going to do ALL examples.. welcome to UNIVERSITY. He also scales hard. Do practice questions and review the hw (shows up on final and some midterm ques!!!)

Probably one of the most arrogant profs out there who just loves to give you a hard time whenever. Since when did asking a simple question become such a pain in the butt? He has poor time management and skips through a lot of material as we approach the end of the semester. Most definitely would've bombed this course if it were not for my tutor.
Be prepared to learn on your own because Jeremy only gives 1 example per question. Hard material which means you need to send more time after each lecture.

I find calculus extremely difficult, but Jeremy was by far one of the best Math teachers I have ever had. Laid back, entertaining, and allowed for a lot of engagement in the course all the while being extremely informative in his subject area. Since I am probably failing the class, I hope I can take the course with him again.
He shows that he cares about his students. Pretty young and he is passionate about math. Always takes questions from students during lectures and plays music before he starts. Very approachable.

Awesome teacher. I find it hard to listen in class but with Jeremy I managed to pay attention in every class. His lecture notes were very helpful as looking over those notes and doing a few questions on the textbook prepared me well for the exam. He is a funny teacher and I loved how he makes jokes in class and plays music at the beginning of class

He put himself behind on covering material early on. At the end he barely covered all the material and didn't have time for any final review sessions. His tests are fair and come from the HW and lectures but he's really bad at explaining and often skips over steps claiming he doesn't have time. It's best to learn it on your own and look up videos.

Overall a pretty good prof. He clearly shows passion towards the subject in every lecture and makes lots of puns. His lectures are engaging and if you actually try and put work in then I'm sure you will do well, but you gotta really try. Jeremy Chiu was a great prof to have though! His interest in bees is quite amusing :)
Jeremy makes an effort to help students understand the importance and uses of calculus. Also very approachable for extra help and gives good feedback. Highly recommend.

Jeremy made our math classes really interesting and engaging.  He made my classmates and myself motivated to come to class and learn about math.  Jeremy was always willing to help during his office hours and took pride in being very organised, placing all the course material in one accessible place.  If you can take this course with Jeremy do it!

Being someone who dislikes math, I found the material somewhat difficult, however, Jeremy made this course so much more enjoyable by showing us his own applications of the concepts we were learning (he's very passionate for bees).  He is also very approachable in office hour and is very eager to help students with homework and unclear concepts.

Jeremy is an exceptional professor. As someone who is not very math savvy I found his lectures very helpful and generally not too difficult to follow. It's hard to make a course with such a difficult curriculum bearable, but Jeremy did just that. He was approachable and always accessible outside of class time. (The bee tie was cool too).

Jeremy is clearly an enthusiastic and hardworking prof. My only complaints are that he tends to skip a lot of the examples in the homework which can make studying difficult. He also tends to run out of time quite a bit, but that's just because he is a bit of newer, His tests are challenging but fair for the most part. Not a bad choice for calc.

His passion is contagious!!! I think he is making me like math?!! Class opened my eyes and made me see beauty in math. I know I can't believe it either but I actually don't hate math now. What?! Also super funny. Jokes makes my day. Genuinely cares about the success of his students too:)) song choices questionable though.
He's an awesome prof!! very funny

I went to all the lectures and i didn't learn anything. Despite me attending every class and taking notes, i still struggled with homework every week. My friend had to teach me EVERYTHING! There was a group project which was stupid for a math class and he made lame jokes. I honestly wouldn't take this course with him!

Jeremy was fantastic! He's a super funny guy, always cracking jokes and making class enjoyable. He's approachable and genuinely willing to help those who struggle. He has made math slightly more bearable. Just do your homework and ask for help, and you'll be good to go. *ps: his music choices are a 5/10

HANDS DOWN, Jeremy was the best prof I have ever had at SFU. What a great guy. He cared for his students and made it known that if you needed help, he would gladly stay late and talk with you if you looked for it. Tests were very fair and marking was reasonable. Quizzes were easy and straight from homework, not a hard class but still gotta work.

If you actually do the hw and additional instructor questions it shouldn't be hard. Tests and quizzes are the smell difficulty as the instructor questions. Clear grading criteria, always willing to help if you ask. Would definitely take again but make sure not to skip class and posted notes can be confusing if you don't attend class.
Great prof. He made lectures fun and the exams were very fair. Not an easy class but a great effort was made to help people do well.

He's an awesome prof. If you do the homework and read his lecture slides you will do fine on the midterm. The final was fair, but many people said it was harder. (I did way better on my final than my midterms and managed to pull off a decent grade).

I took both MATH 154 and 155 with Dr. Gray and was very happy I did. Extremely clear and concise when explaining concepts. Approachable, very helpful. Loved his interesting and weird sense of humor too. Great prof!
A cool guy but not the best  prof... He explains things as if people should already understand them. I found watching YouTube videos to be much more effective to learn the material.
I have him for math 155 and he is a great prof,the quizzes are directly from assignments,if you study you gonna get a great mark,although exams are little bit hard.
Love him! I had him for both Math 154 and 155. He's great!

Takes it at a slow pace. Midterms are tough, but fair. Final had a couple of easy questions but overall extremely hard. But, he takes that into account when deciding grades. My ONLY complaints were that some h/w was seemingly unrelated to lecture & i hated when he used a random computer graphing tool  Overall GREAT!!!
Hes a great teacher, the first two midterms were easy and the last one was a killer.
Tough Final, Hot Guy

DUDE I DON'T EVEN KNOW HOW TO TELL YOU THIS but if you ever get a chance ti take a class with Dr.Jamie JUST DO IT I MEAN IT!! he provides lectures on YouTube so no need to attend class,ATTEND f his office hours. he is so sweet and so caring. whatever questions you have he will answer it . I LOVE JAMIEEE PLZ TAKE HIS CLASs if U COULD

TAKE HIM FOR MATH155!! DONT THINK JUST DO IT. All the exams were really easy it was definitely easy to over study for an exam. he did lectures in person and also went home and recorded them online separately for students who couldn't attend. He made everything so simple and easy. 10/10 would take any class with him again.

Math 155 barely had integration and had more calc 3 stuff. Jamie made the class easy. for exams just know how to do every single example in the notes. Jamie is an amazing prof as he explains everything clearly and his pre lecture videos were 100 times better then all the other profs

Jamie was an awesome prof. Take math155 with him especially if your math skills are poor or you are redoing the course. Before I took calculus 2 with Jamie I always struggled with math. At the end of the semester I finally not only got an A, but understood the content completely.
His notes are clear and he makes things simple. His accent is cute. Tests can be seemingly easy but are tricky.U get ur $ worth with this math prof.

His midterms are fair but I wouldn't say easy. It really helps to do the  questions from the textbook because it will train you to be able to do questions faster with more accuracy on the midterms. His final was harder, the average was about a 65% but it was still a fair exam.

Alan Meichner is by far one of the best profs I've ever had. Calc is usually really dreadful for me but he made it super easy! GO TO HIS LECTURES! It is worth it. He is really clear in his explanations, always answers any questions you and and super helpful. His exams are really fair, do the assignments and review his notes and you'll do great !
Great professor. never enjoyed calculus. midterm questions come from textbook, assignments. Ridiculously hard final.
He was really helpful and nice! I really liked him as a professor :)

One of the best Math profs that I've had so far at SFU.  Crystal clear and explains everything well with great exams.  The final was quite hard, but do the questions, do the homework and you'll be fine.
Excellent prof. Final was brutal though...

I did not do well in the class as math is not my strong suit, but he is the best math professor I've had to date. Crystal clear lectures, gives good examples, and is very helpful in the calculus workshop, even if your question is "easy" he will still take his time to explain and make sure you are following. Highly recommended.
Most of his exam questions come from examples given in class. Make sure you attend his lectures. He usually tells you what materials you need for exam. Crystal clear prof. Highly recommended.

The course and content is honestly pretty hard, so I think its easy to blame him for getting a bad grade. But he does go over everything thoroughly in class, and answers your questions well. He's a good prof, just not the best curriculum, and tests are very difficult.

JF was very understanding that this course had life sciences students. Concepts were easy to understand and exams were fair. Do the practice exams, as the questions will be very similar. Overall a nice prof and very approachable!
Exams were fair and assignments weren't too difficult.  He cares about his students and wants them to succeed.

Was really behind because I had to miss about a month of school + Midterm 2 due to a car accident, but JF was very patient and understanding. I had only about ~1.5week to prep for the final, but he encouraged me to try my best. inspired me to study very hard. He graded very fairly at the end, given my context. Very happy with my final grade!
His exams are fair and he is willing to help students, do the practice problems he gives before exams .
He nailed Math 155 perfectly. Exams are pretty fair
JF is one awesome dude and a pretty good prof too

JF is very aware of the fact this course is for life science majors and teaches its accordingly. Exams were all reasonable, just practice the problem sets from class and the practice exams. He's a very caring professor whos looking out for the class.

He understands that anyone in Math155 (life science math) isn't a math major, and treats the course accordingly. You only really learn what matters, which I appreciate. The content focuses on relevant techniques, as opposed to abstract and purely mathematical concepts that you would find in a regular calculus class. Exams are easy enough.

Used another professors pre recorded lectures to teach this course. It became abundantly clear when he'd modify said other prof's material as it never made sense. Some assignments the variables were changed to be impossible. Exams were doubled in length compared to prior years. Not difficult but a race to actually finish the problems.

Ralf is hit-or-miss as a lecturer, but using resources like unstuck study alongside the textbook helps fill in the gaps. Exams are reflective of in-class content, so staying on top of the work is key.

He's a good dude for sure and since this was his first time teaching (as stated by himself), he fell short when it came to explanations. Just do the work and you'll understand what he was trying to say in lecture much like how every other math class is for me.

Barely showed up on time and fell behind in lectures frequently, but had good lecture slides and examples. Exams strongly reflective of content from lectures and written hw. Frequently teaches content the day that hw is due, so need to be on top of it. Compassionate, so will push the deadline forward if enough ppl complain a lot of the time.

Very disorganised, did not answer emails, did not even tell us what the final covered. The course itself is very easy (didnt go to lecture, just taught myself from yt or ben ashby) but he just made it harder for no reason. Tests are identical to lecture examples and written assignments

Can be a little disorganized at times and falls behind in lecture but honestly isn't bad as a lecturer. Make sure to watch prelecture vids prior to going to lec as he serves more as a review of concepts than actually learning it. Exam questions are often pulled from written assignments

Ralf is an outstanding professor who is deeply passionate about mathematics and highly dedicated to his lectures. His exams are not difficult, often resembling in-class examples. They are also less challenging compared to the IQ or written assignments he assigns. Overall, Ralf is a wonderful professor who genuinely loves the subject he teaches!!

Did not do much to help the students, unorganized and do not even try to email him he will not reply ( go to math workshop itll save your life). Lectures are hard to understand even when the concepts themselves are on the lighter slide just really boring and a ramble fest.

Always late and very disorganized. He clearly has no respect for his students and does not value our time. He was late posting notes and solutions including posting material the night before our final that was 50% of our grade. He was also consistently behind in lecture material and even skipped lectures that were on the midterm. Avoid!!!

Alright, yes he comes to class late almost everytime and yes we were always behind on lecture. DO THE IQs cuz trust me they helpful asf. A lot of the IQ questions show up on the mid terms or final. BUY LORD PI's Mid term and FINAL PACKAGES, THEY ARE SO GOOD. (Lord pi, is like a tutor who has his own discord server, so join the math server and ask)

AVOID HIM AT ALL COST, PLEASE DON'T WASTE MONEY ON HIM. HE WILL GIVE YOU HELL, THE GUY NEVER EMAILS ANYONE BACK NEITHER DOES HE REPLY. HE DIDN'T EMAIL US ON WHAT'S GOING TO BE ON THE FINAL, NOT ONLY THAT. HE IS SOOO UNRGANIZED, HE IS SO UNHELPFUL. LIKE I HAVE NOTHING ELSE TO SAY EXCEPT IF YOU WANT A GOOD GRADE PLEASE AVOID HIM PLEASE.

Ralf is a great prof, and super helpful when you go talk to him personally. Although he did show up late to class 95% of the time. If you don't go to lectures it is hard to succeed in this course since the filled in notes get posted days/weeks late. Our final exam is tomorrow, and the solution to the last homework still hasn't been posted.

-I've had him twice, both times we were/are behind and he does nothing to try to catch up
-Takes him days to upload lecture slides
-Goes through the day before's lecture (the reason we are behind) but uses a different set of lecture slides, so you have to download a second set of lecture notes for every lecture.
-Comes late everyday (No joke)

Just avoid him at all times.
Always late to class.
Skip materials and put it in the midterms...

He's a nice enough guy, but he yaps to the point where a week into lecture he's already a lecture behind. And he shows no intent to catchup/go faster. Plus for material we've already covered last lecture, he'll spend another 15 mins in the next lecture going over it again. Ralf I didn't want to rate you like this but you have left me no choice.

Dr. Chan was an amazing prof. The lecture material itself was often difficult to understand, but he always explained it well and clarified whenever students were confused. He was a very patient and understanding prof and I think he's just a good person general. the exams and quizzes were always super fair and he was an easy grader
Awesome Prof, was very straightforward and would hold office hours in person and online. Exams had high averages and he made the content easy to understand. Goated prof would recommend

He was amazing at making what you learn more understandable. If you go to lecture, and do the practice questions/exams, you will do well. He provides a lot of extra help. Exams are straightforward. Sometimes gets upset if you talk during lecture.
His lectures are very helpful, and he makes the topics a lot easier to understand. His practice midterms help a lot as well. He sometimes gets upset if you talk while he is talking.

He left us halfway through the semester and I didn't think I would miss his teaching style but boy did I ever. He does lots and lots of examples which is awesome, but you definitely have to go to lecture to get the notes. His notes are clear and well done. He has an accent, but it does not detract from learning and can be kind of funny sometimes.

Had Dr. Lisonek for only half a semester because of a sick leave. It was very unfortunate because I really liked how he gave a lot of examples in his notes. Attend lectures as the notes aren't posted anywhere. His exams were fair if you do the course notes and other homework! His accent is very amusing!

Must attend his lectures to get the notes, doesn't post filled notes, which is understandable. Has an accent. You need to yell loudly for him to hear your question (seriously!), he does NOT try to ignore students,he just can't hear well sometimes. Good prof,and fair,and he reminded the students of the available past exams on SFU's official website.

He goes over many examples in lectures (he may go through it fast, but the pace was fine for me). He is a nice teacher and he encourages questions in/out of lec. Midterm was fair; just practice as much as you can (lec notes, IQ, CN, maybe OQ but meh) & understand concepts since that's generally how you can do well in calc

Can come off as mean or rude, not that friendly when you ask questions. Very good examples in class and variations of them show up on exams. Study his examples and you will do well, along with the true false questions from the practice midterms online from the math department.

One of the most intelligent and kindest professors in sfu. Was patient with me in the ACW for extra help and made sure i understand the material. He left us mid semester on sick leave and i honestly miss his teaching style. Hope he makes a speedy recovery.

Petr was a really good prof. He uses a lot of examples during lectures which is amazing and so useful for exams. I only had him for half the semester but I wish I had him for the entire thing. Assigned textbook questions are good to follow before exams and the questions on the exams were very fair if you went over lecture and text examples.

He's a really great prof and super nice and helpful during office hours. His accent may be a little thick but totally understandable and makes going to lecture all that much more interesting. If you just print out his notes and attend lecture you'll do just fine.

He's super nice and very helpful during office hours/in the workshop. Midterms were a lot more fair and averages were pretty high compared to 154.  I found his final easier than the practice ones. Even if math isn't your thing its still possible to do well just stay on top of homework

lectures were painfully boring, midterms were EASY (just study past midterms), the final was more difficult. even if you don't pay attention in class, make sure you write down his examples. and his accent is awesome.

Despite what others have complained about, he's a great prof. and this is coming from someone that HATES math! His accent does take some getting used to though, but his explainations are clear and concise. I found the final more easy than the two midterms oddly enough.

The first few lectures were a bit boring. However, as the class progressed they got alot better. The midterms were VERY fair. I found the final exam challenging but also fair as most of the questions had been discussed in class, in the examples in the book, or were on an old exams available on web ct.

I thought it was boring class in the begining of semester but I got better. Midterms are easy if you study(or just do your homework by yourself) but final exams are hard. This prof hated chatting during the class..

Great prof, explained concepts clearly, although his accent was a little bit difficult to understand at first if you get over it you can learn a lot from him. He might seem scary but very nice and helpful. Exams were mostly based of lectures and his examples. Fairly ok exams.

He's a good teacher and makes himself available during two office hours/week (not many people went to them). The midterms weren't difficult if you did the homework (homework is out of the textbook so you don't need to buy it if you can get a reserves copy). Final was harder than I expected; it was all the hard questions from lecture and homework.

At first he seemed intimidating and then as you get to know him, you can tell he really wants his students to learn. You will get used to his accent in no time, and his notes are crystal clear like a text book. The exams were all hard, but fair.
Some questions on his final were fair, others were far too complex for the amount of points they were worth. Midterms weren't bad though, but like I said..the final killed
A fairly okay teacher. His english though is sometimes hilarious. He doesn't like it when people talk to loud. His exams are fairly decent if you have studied.

Explains difficult concepts throughly and does quite a bit of examples in class which helps in understanding the material. Midterms and finals are similar to the practice ones, he gives some tricky questions but overall the exams are fair.

He has very clear notes which are easy to understand. He spends time on difficult concepts and slows down so everyone understands. Has a Russian or German accent but it's easy to understand him. He closely mirrors his practice exams. Exams are difficult but very fair. Exam questions are from lectures. GO TO HIS LECTURES!

Overall a good prof especially for 1st yrs as he speaks very slowly and emphasizes important concepts very well. Tests are fair and lectures are valuable. Although he isn't I thought he looked kinda mean. I like his accent =)
he's a little boring at times but hey, it's math. he's an alright guy. nice mostly legible notes on webct. no real surprises on exams
Considering how hard the material was, he did a really good job explaining. His exams are really fair. He's a really nice guy, and his jokes aren't bad.

Petr amuses me to no end with his crazy analogies. The class is difficult, but he makes learning calculus funny. We need to "kill the two" and there are "upstairs and downstairs" to rational functions. Sometimes, you just have to "massage" the function to get what you need to work with, even if it is a "compost" function. Oh those crazy Russians.
This is a pretty hard course with a lot being covered in a short period of time! Really important to keep up with everything by yourself. Overall a good prof, would recommend her.
Super nice! Easy quizzes and reasonable midterm & final!

Wonderful teacher, really made the 8:30 class rather enjoyable. Midterms  and final was fair. If I didn't mess up one question on first midterm might have gotten an A+, but with the little work I had to do in this class (yes, thats how clear she was), I'm very content. Definitely recommend her. Oh, and no assignments, just a simple quiz each week
Tests are tough, but fair. Study hard

Brenda is a great prof! She's clear and knows how to answer your questions if you have any. She'll actually make sure you do the homework and get practice by giving homework quizzes every Friday but they're all pretty easy because it has to be done in 10 minutes so as long as you pay attention in lecture, you'll get those.

Brenda is an amazing prof in lectures. Everything is super clear and she is willing to answer any questions without hesitation or confusion. The midterm was haaaard. I was getting 68 and 78 on the quizzes and that wasn't even close to representative of the grade I received on the midterm. Do endless practice questions.

He is a new professor, so cant really expect much I guess.  The problems were that he gave really difficult midterms and had quizzes every Friday with limited time that were kind of hard.  He is okay but not the best.

Keshav is a great calc prof.  This class was tough, but he did a good job.  Tests were fair, was really helpful during office hours and via email.  He is very respectful and very humble. This course requires a lot, lots of homework. Final was scaled.

Math was never my thing but he was a good prof. His examples in class tend to be much easier than the homework questions, but he is available if there is anything you don't understand. I would recommend him.

Midterms have exact same questions/concept as review sheet except with modified numbers. make sure you study those! However, Final exam had very specific things and 20 marks on multiple choice. Very helpful clear at explaining. Overall a good prof.

I'm not a math person but overall it didn't kill me. I really liked Dr. Mukunda because he's funny and friendly and his notes are clear and organized most of the time. His midterms and final are fair and pretty much EXACTLY the same as his review sheets. Would definitely recommend!

Even tho this was the 1st time he taught this course, he knew the material well. He was so confident w/ it that he could explain it 3 different ways so you would understand. Overall fair. Final was hard, he focused on odd concepts & excluded others. Put stuff on there from Math 154. But overall I'd give him an A
Shows reasoning for examples, but seems a little unsure. Do the homework assignments and make sure you do the reviews before midterms.

He has a great personality however that in no way means that he is a good prof when it comes to teaching. He gets off topic very easily and is extremely difficult to follow! His class was extremely frustrating because the notes don't help at all and he doesn't even bother to put up the answers to the reviews before exams! Cannot teach well! :/
Great professor!

Would definitely take a class with Professor Are again. You need to put in the work and do the textbook questions and come to class prepared, but if you put in the work, you are guaranteed success in his class. He is also readily available after class for questions and office hours.
Professor Are is VERY considerate.
chill prof. Exams were from Webassign and lecture notes.

Dr. Are cares about his students and always tries to explain concepts, even if only 1 person asks. Though I did find the videos he posted to be easier to understand than him sometimes. He also specified which topics would be on the exams, which was extremely helpful. The course was graded on few things and had a 50% final, which I think was scaled.
Awesome prof! Loved every lecture since he made them super relatable. Also, it was mega helpful how he pointed out what to focus on for midterms and exams.

One of the Best Profs to take Math 155 with, SUPER NICE GUY You won't really understand him, unless you situp front, but MAKE SURE TO GO TO HIS REVIEW LECTURES, AND READ HIS EMAIL ABOUT WHAT IS ON THE EXAMS, IT IS HIGHLY ACCURATE. If he says don't worry about a topic, then don't. Go to ACAW to learn anything that your not clear about.
The best prof ever!!
Would take any course with him again! He was so considerate

Jamie was a bit slow in his lectures, which may benefit some, but he was very helpful during office hours. Exams were copy and paste from his lecture notes. If you want an A in this class, you have to practice A LOT. I received a good grade by literally redoing the problems over and over again. This course is very content heavy, but manageable.

Absolutely goated prof. Written Q's are difficult, but none the less he is just plain out really good at teaching and making you understand the material. He explains well, goes at a good pace, is easy to listen to and MOST IMPORTANTLY, his writing is super neat!

Professor Mulholland was great! He explained all topics thoroughly and I rarely had questions after the lectures. There were two homework assignments each week which weren't too long but some IQs were difficult. The live lectures rarely got through all the material so you did have to watch the recorded lecture in addition to attending in person.

Super caring and dedicated to teaching. Though this course got me traumatized and I wouldnt take math again, have to admit Jamie is the GOAT and his lecs are really informative. 100% recommend taking him, but not 155 lmao

Although Jamie wasn't my professor (I was in the D300 section) I still only watched his lectures lol. He is an amazing prof and he makes learning the content incredibly easier and big props to him for being able to do that for a difficult course. The exams are fair and the final is basically just a combination of the 2 midterms, take math with him!
Jamie is the BEST MATH professor. He is amazing at explaining the material and actually makes math enjoyable.
AMAZING PROF IN EVERY ASPECT
Goated Prof.

The professor was nice, she tried her best to engage the class & always stopped to ask for questions. Sometimes, lectures were confusing since she skipped steps. Quizzes were helpful because they forced me to study and review lol. Midterms were fair, but the final exam was way harder. Luckily, she adjusted the grades :) +crib sheets were useful!

course wasn't too difficult, practice w/ IQ assignments as they are identical to exam questions. I liked this class a lot more than calc1 (grade:C) and found it a lot simpler. she does skip over important slides in class, but she posts completed slides after. not the worst, not the best. PREPARE FOR FINAL!!!

The course isn't too bad however it's very fast. There's a lot of work including weekly in class quizzes and it's hard to stay on top of it. Lectures were pointless you're gonna have to teach yourself everything. The midterms were easy but the final was hard and it's worth 50% of your grade.

She was nice, but she would sometimes skip over important steps when explaining a problem, which was confusing. She has summaries for each topic in the solutions to her problem sets which were helpful. The weekly online assignmemts arent too bad as long as you start working on them early. The weekly quizzes arent given enough time to complete.

Dr. Macpherson is a lovely person, but the lectures were horrible. The lecture videos were confusing and difficult to follow. Midterms and finals did not reflect what was taught at all. I'd recommend using YouTube to learn everything. I only passed bc the class was curved.

Math 154 and math 155 are two of the worst classes I've ever taken it's like they want you to fail. Prof.Macpherson tried her best and she was nice and all but still doesnt rlly know how to teach. you have to teach yourself EVERYTHING. first midterm is as easy as it gets. Lots of hw. Pre lecture videos were useless. COME TO LECTURE dont fall behind
Lectures not helpful. Fast paced. Reached out for help, was not helpful. Get ready to teach yourself via YouTube

It's always a race, impossible to keep up with the notes, much less learn in lectures. Quizzes and exams are ridiculously packed for the time aloted. The first midterms when so bad she didn't release the average.

Taking this class with Adam is do-able, but you have to put A LOT of effort in. His lectures were fine, but since he comes across as not caring about the material at all, it is hard to care yourself. He is chronically late to lectures too.
god awful "professor" if you can even call him that. avoid for the love of your gpa.

Honestly I don't think Adam was that bad. I think MATH155 is just very difficult in general. He was always late which was annoying to some but honestly I didn't really mind. I HIGHLY suggest you go to the Math workshop at least once a week and get help with your IQs. It helps so much. Also, the key to doing well in this class is tons of practise
Just not great lecture slides

He's a masters student, so it's to be expected that he isn't as well seasoned as other senior lecturers. However, being behind on material covered due to being late 5-10 minutes and then skimming material that I think most students would consider important was a big red flag. His first midterm was awful but he decreased the difficulty afterwards
Tough marker, hard to reach, and non linear note taking
Unreasonable and can't teach, not sure why he's still here
Just very uninvolved
unreasonable

Adam: instead of marshalling his powers of concentration, limited as they may be, to become a good calc 2 teacher, adam decided to take a turn and screw us all over by combining 2 and 3 at the same time. Furthermore, he was 5-10 minutes late every single lecture. I strongly recommend that you avoid him for the love of your GPA.

Adam was terrible at teaching and his exams did not reflect my understanding of the course very well. do not take this prof for math 155 unless you want to put alot of effort and receive a C+ at best. Would not recommend at all.

I genuinely cannot understand those who gave adam a four or even a five. He is absolutely horrid because he is uninterested in the concept of the course nor does he care about the students' learning even the tiniest bit. adam is incompetent at what he does, yet he shows a lack of time and effort it needs to excel as an instructor.

His first midterm was pretty rough, but he took the constructive feedback and made the second midterm and final much easier. He was super accessible for extra help and really cares about his students. Sadly, late to class a lot. Overall I would still recommend this prof :)

Great professor! He posts clear filled notes after lectures. The midterms and assignments were fair and based on course material. The final exam was great to demonstrate your knowledge. Study his notes and read the textbook and youre set. Hes also very good with replying to emails and explaining concepts that you dont understand. Thank you Mr. D

Exams are long but if you actually study off the review packages then you should be fine, the actual questions themselves arent that hard but you dont really have time to pause during exam. his notes are straightforward and easy to grasp. his class definitely requires a lot of work but its easy if you put the time into it

Apart from the fact that this prof is quite monotone (which makes it hard to stay focused in class, especially at 8:30am) he explains the concepts clearly. His exams are fair, although more on the difficult side, but as long as you keep up with the material throughout the semester it'll be possible to do well in this course.

Okay so he's not quite as bad as his reviews say, but he's a mediocre instructor at best. Honestly I just think he's inexperienced. His notes are pretty clear and helpful for studying, but lectures are extremely boring. His midterms are stupid long. You'll probably do alright if you just review the notes on your own and do practice problems.

Despite what everyone is saying on here, Adam is actually a great prof. He does heaps of examples and his notes are fantastic. Exams are long, so be ready for that but if you know what's up you should be fine. I know he seems a bit subdued, but that's just his personality guys! If you actually talked to him you'd realise he's pretty great.

Homework takes at least 10 hours a week, cannot teach to save his life, AND rushes through classes and examples because hes behind on material since hes 5-10mins late almost every single lecture. Hes monotone, uninterested in the course material or his students. He doesn't reply to emails, and lied about the midterm averages and is a masters stdnt

Goes through examples too quickly and does not explain his work well. Doesn't know how to explain thoroughly. Class average was super low for the midterms. You need to put in A LOT of time and effort for this class but that does not equate to a good grade. Don't recommend this class with this prof.

Don't listen to the good ratings bc i'm pretty sure the only good ratings he gets are the ones that he gives to himself. never ever under any conditions take this prof (unless you are a math genius). Terrible terrible teaching! Everybody hates him

Very lazy and very monotone. He will assign you homework based on stuff that weren't even taught in the course. Unwilling to adapt to students' needs and continues to be inefficient at teaching. Avoid him at all costs.

Took a financial hit and dropped his class without receiving any refund. Lost a decent amount of money, but this class deteriorated my mental health. Monotone, lazy, and not willing to help students succeed. After the midterm average was a fail, he continued to blame the students and refused to change anything for the next one.

It's a first year math. he's mono tone, breathes rlly loud, speeds through examples. you should be able to understand if you took 154. if not just google the little things that you dont understand. 2 assignments a week and you have to print out/fill out notes in class. notes are stright from the textbook they give you on canvas
I wish there was an option to give a rating of 0/5 because this prof doesn't even deserve that 1/5

He was by far the least punctual 'professor' I have seen so far. Sped through absolutely fundamental concepts of calculus because he would waste up to ten minutes of a fifty minute lecture every other day. He spent the first ten minutes of midterm class making announcements when he could have sent out emails.

If I had known what this profs tests were like, I would have dropped the class at the beginning of the semester. Time was wasted before the 1st midterm to do an announcement, which could have easily been an email. The material on the midterm was not the same concepts which were heavily focused on in class, and the marking scheme was unfair.

Constantly late to class. (5-10) minutes each and every lecture. There is a good reason why his math 100 and math 155 midterm averages are 50 or below. In lecture speeds through crucial topics too quickly. His one strong suit is one on one during his office hours he can explain well. Not in front of 400 people. Would recommend avoiding at all costs

Goes over course notes way too quickly. All he does in his lectures is reading the notes out loud in a very monotone voice. I withdrew from his class and I highly suggest that you also withdraw if you care about your GPA.
Bruce!  Awesome math prof.  Funny as hell and very kind.  Good marker and did i mention, funny?

Was late to his own class every time, made errors every lecture, and then (no joke) abandoned us when classes were moved online due to covid-19. The math department had to force him to talk to us, and then he dumped us on a Surrey math prof. Super unprofessional and scatter-brained. No calculator in exams but expects us to do difficult calculations

The online questions didn't really match the midterm and final questions. Lecture examples and questions listed under course notes were the best indication of what the midterm and final were going to be like. Definitely not enough time on the midterm to complete the questions. Final was hard and given by another teacher-not Luis.

do not take this course with Luis. I have had the worst experience in his class. he makes uncountable mistakes in lectures and is usually 5 minutes late to class and then he wouldn't complete examples saying he would fill them in later. this class has hard material itself but Luis made it even harder.

Not great at explaining, seems like he has trouble organizing his thoughts while trying to teach. Tests are marked super hard and apparently no part marks are given and are way too long for the time given. The average for the midterm was 48.5%

Dr. Goddyn explains concepts very clearly, however,many typos in his lectures, in his exams no calculator is permitted and in questions you have to apply what you learned rather than solve problems. Also, not enough time for his exams.

As nice of a person he was, teaching ability is straight up terrible. He literally brought the textbook with him and copied examples out of it, but got confused and made it harder to learn b/c when i stopped going i got better marks. Also very unprofessional as he never shows up on time and some exam questions are nothing like TB or even past exams
Always late. Lectures and examples are straight out of the textbook, does not explain topics and questions clearly what so ever

Luis Goddyn is a great Math Prof. His lectures are easy to follow and the examples are mostly basic ones from the textbook. His teaching style is good for those who are not the best in Math as he goes through examples very clearly. His exams were fair, and you can expect a decent mark if you attempt practice problems in the textbook.

Many mistakes in every lecture. his lectures are straight out of the textbooks, he has the textbook open in front of him while hes teaching and just reads word for word, and makes the examples even more complicated. You're better off just teaching yourself. His tests are nothing like the assigned homework

Consistently late and pretty unorganized. Explains concepts clearly, gives simple examples in class. Exams are fair (expect questions where you need to APPLY what you learn to a new style of question, often different from assigned homework)
Doesn't do good examples, never gives the full time for the quizzes and very unorganized

Although consistently tardy, he makes up for it with a flamboyant charm. I find his notes may cover only the simplest examples, all of which come from the text book. But he is always open to questions and makes a great effort explaining using two projectors if he has to. Definitely a wonderful profesor.
What a charming and funny prof! Makes class interesting and fun. Don't know what these other kiddies are complaining about. One of the better profs at SFU!

Navid really does care about his students, and you can tell. He was a TA for MATH 154. His downfall is that he teaches the course more as a TA rather than an actual prof. I feel as if he expects us to know some of the material already much like a TA would when helping a student with questions. This makes learning new material very challenging.
Lecture notes are for the most part unhelpful. His tests are not reasonable given the amount of time, expect every single question to be a trick.

Navid cares, however he is quite unexperienced and makes it very  hard for his students.  Navid uses waterproof ink on his exams so the tears of his students do not smudge the writing. For a visual representation of what it's like being in his class see "the red wedding"

His first semester teaching here, makes very challenging questions for both assignments and tests. Quizzes are directly taken from assignment, but the first midterm average was 35%. Always makes mistakes when teaching and needs students to correct him. Expects a lot from you and says it was an "easy" midterm. Try to avoid if you can.

WORST TEACHER EVER! I really dont expect this at a university level, but he really cant teach! his lectures are pointless, he mumbles, notes not legible midterms are hard and he is just such a bad teacher!!!! wow

The goat.
His awesome youtube channel got me through 155 even when I wasnt in his class, huge thanks for putting those up.
In all my time at sfu, Ben Ashby was one of the few profs that was able to take a boring class and make it interesting and easier to learn.
Godly. Take a course with him just for your academic soul's well-being.

Honestly didn't even take a class with him, but my prof would post his lecture videos for MATH 155 and they were so much easier to follow along to compared to my prof's work. His review videos were also very helpful and he's great at explaining concepts. His voice is also easy to listen to lol
very nice asmr type of voice, 10/10 would recommend

Ben cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Had class with him last year and is by far the best prof I've had. This class isn't easy but you won't get a better prof than Ben Ashby.
He makes class enjoyable and considering how uninteresting math155 at 8:30 in the morning can be, he makes it quite enjoyable. 
He has a cool accent too.

Ben is one of the good ones. Take his class if you can because you'll love him. The material can be tough but you won't get a better prof than Ben at sfu. He makes topics interesting and he really cares about the success of his students. Ben if you're reading this, I love you.
as you can tell from everyones review, he is the goat in math, its rlly easy and he's active in the discord. bashby is good at explaining and his lectures are online, so you can skip

Bashby is by far the best math prof I've had. He truly cares about his students successes. He is easy to talk to and provides great lectures. There are pre-lecture videos that need to be watched before class. I totally recommend taking his courses. Oh and I cant forget to include that he may be active on your discord servers for easy communication!

I made this course an elective course so it didn't touch my GPA because I no longer needed it for my Biology degree. Dr. Ashby is an amazing prof though, the course was just very difficult for me, and I think they're unrelated. He takes the time to get you to understand things. Do your online assignments.

This was a very fair class. Attending lectures is a good idea if you are aiming for a high grade as he does very well with explaining the concepts. Although some of the concepts can be confusing at times the material was relatively easy. You should definitely join the discord , this will help you on both the IQ's and OQ's for an easy grade booster.

Dr. Ashby is great, his exams are very closely matched to the lecture material, he is always available outside of class for help and he takes lots of time to explain concepts to students. He is the dream math professor, if you get the chance to take math with him, just do it.

Best professor I have had at SFU by far. He was on our discord server so it was very easy to get in touch with him. All lectures and pre-lectures were recorded and were relatively easy. He doesn't walk you through the material learned in 154 so make sure you have a general understanding of those concepts. No textbook or participation necessary.
Such a great professor! He is so nice and his lectures are easy to follow. He makes the class and the lecture material interesting. Definitely would take this class again if I could!

Take this course with Dr. Ashby!!! You wont regret it! He is one of the most caring, understanding, and funny profs I've had at SFU and he made all the content very interesting to learn. His lectures were easy to follow along and his exams were extremely fair. He also was available outside of class hours for help and responded to emails promptly!

Amazing prof! Great lectures and pre-lectures that explain everything clearly, and the practice problems that are given, as well as the instructor questions, are the types of questions that are on the exams.

great prof, very straight forward and easy to follow along with. Will always help you and answer your questions. Never watched pre lecs as he did an amazing job explaining the content in class. Would take math with him again

Very fair, is accessible and does best to answer questions in office hours. Great attitude and humor, lots of class practice and is active in discord. There are IQs and OQs for the class, textbook needed for access. I'd say self-study is needed, so practice on ur own time; it's easy to get lost in the class but Dr. Ashby is really caring!

Best math profs ive had he makes things so clear and if you have a question he's so accessible because he's either responding to students on discord, emailing you back or has his office hours. Exams are so fair he genuinely wants his students to do well I think he even made a little survey midway through the sem to see how everyone liked the class

Seriously a great prof. Very fair with homework and exams in terms of difficulty and length. His office hours are accessible and he will clarify anything from prelecture material at the start of class. Plus, the ACW is available if you are confused. Just stay on top of the material and you will do great in the course.

Many students complain about Dr. Ashby's pre-lectures being too confusing and difficult, but he tells us to seek help from him or the ACW. Also, there's a reason he asks if anyone has questions about the pre-lecture material and does in-class examples. Ignore the bad ratings; I highly recommend having Dr. Ashby for Math 155.

Great bloke and clearly explains concepts but he seriously has to get rid of ads on his youtube cause im always getting the same one for miro and i know what shorty is gonna say i doubt he's making money off of his vids so just please take them off for the future generations of math 155 students

Dr. Ashby was very helpful inside and outside of class. I frequently attended his office hours and he made sure I understood anything I was confused on. He also listens to students' suggestions to improve the class, based on the survey he uploaded after our first midterm. I would heavily recommend having Dr. Ashby as a professor.

If you're taking math 155, take it with him. Amazing professor. Accessible outside of class and responds to questions/feedback quickly, you can trust him with his words. lectures and exams wise, he does his best to make sure students understands the topics and adjusts exams so students have a chance to do better. Big Ben on top

An absolute mad lad. He knows that Manchester is red and that's all that matters. Albeit, he does support a midtable club, he's lucky I didn't take give him a 4 just for that. Legendary prof though nonetheless.
It's kinda crazy to see any bad reviews for Ben. He listens to all the feedback he gets and his exams / homework are fair in length and have the same difficulty as class problem

Testing is really hard. Needs work on teaching style. Online videos are more for online/ summer courses. His style for fall/spring needs to change. Would recommend for a student who likes online classes. Although pre lectures are confusing without any clarifications in class.

I love Professor Ben. Cares so much about his students, is accessible online at most hours of the day. Very accommodating and tries his hardest in everything he does. Passionate about biology-calculus and it shows though his effort. I found his first assessment to be fair, just requires self-study which is expected. Absolute stud.

Pre lecture videos are rather confusing and he will continuously skip steps in lectures making them equally as confusing. First midterm was a mix of fairly easy and very difficult questions. Wish he would go into detail for a small number of questions rather than just skip through a lot of questions without fully explaining any of them.
Ben Ashby is the GOAT, he genuinely cares so much about his students

Dr. Ashby has a true love for bio-math and it shows. He takes feedback from students and is an engaging prof. He's always willing to help and even goes around the class when doing "try this" activities to help and answer q's. He's super fair and does his best to listen to the voices of the class. He is organized and keeps students on the same page.

Dr. Ashby is willing to take questions during and after classes. He really cares about this students and was truly passionate about what he was teaching. Very clear lectures and notes and concise, relating to the homework assignments and written. I love Dr.Ashby and it helps he is a stud !

He relies too much on his pre-lecture videos and doesn't teach any new material in class. During lectures, he only goes through practice problems while skipping MANY steps quoting "you guys should be able to do the calculations on your own". I wish he taught material in class and did practice problems as side videos. But he is amazing and kind.
He is the best prof !

Despite being his first semester teaching at SFU he really listened to everyone's feedback to better the class and adapted. Class average was high so that reflects on how well he can teach his material even if the course has a reputation for being difficult. Try enrolling with Professor Ashby and you should be okay
seriously the best prof ever, taking math 155 with him is the only correct choice

His lectures were well-organized, clear, and accessible for students who can't (or don't want to) go to his lectures. He expands on concepts clearly and makes an effort to make the class interactive. Prof Ashby was a great prof.

Dr. Ashby is a great prof and he really cares for his students. He takes feedback really well and is willing to change things according to the feedback. His Lectures and notes are easy to follow. I go to his office hours every time I need help with the homework or just understanding the lecture notes in general and he is very helpful.

If you get the chance, I would seriously consider taking a class with Dr. Ashby. He is incredibly skilled at explaining how to solve different mathematical problems. His problem classes were great for supplementing my learning!
Prof Ashby clearly cares about his students and does his best to accommodate student needs. If you have the chance to take this class with him, take it!
The best professor I have had so far. Great at explaining and providing/structuring course materials.
Really good prof. Exam expectations were clear and he gave lots of material to practice with. Lectures were recorded and posted online which was really nice.

Professor Ashby is by far one of the best profs I have ever taken a class with. His lectures are incredibly organized and easy to follow. His assignments and exams are fair and reasonable. A very caring professor who clearly considers feedback from the class. Highly recommend keeping up with the pre-lectures and problem classes!

After taking math 154 the previous semester, I was terrified for math 155. However, Professor Ashby is one of the most understanding and caring professors I've had by far at SFU. He's always willing to take on feedback. Definitely attend the in person problem classes, they're a great opportunity to understand the style of questions for exams :)

Professor Ashby is by far one of the best professors I have had at SFU. He makes difficult concepts easy to understand and always asks if students understand the material he is teaching. Make sure to watch prelecture videos and goto the problem classes. Professor Ashby also takes students' feelings and opinions into consideration. Highly recommend.
She was hard to understand during lecture and did not go into enough detail on calculus concepts. She expected everyone to know info from MATH154, and was rude if you asked "dumb" questions.
I can see Dr. Kouzniak wanting her students to succeed. She's definitely not scary, but she has a straight forward teaching style since math is a tough subject. I'd recommend taking her.

Dr. Kouzniak is extremely rude toward her students and gets annoyed when anyone used the chat to ask questions. During midterms and weekly quizzes, she doesn't mute herself and continues to talk loudly, distracting everyone. Midterms are fair, but her lectures are unclear and you basically teach yourself the entire course. Avoid her if you can.

not mandatory expect the weekly friday quizzes which are so brutal. her lectures cover way too much, basically goes thru 3/4 of a chapter in one class. a couple times it got so bad during lecture that I literally just gave up and cried. my friend even dropped the class after first week. over 60 students have dropped this course since it started. GL

very rude during class, calls out peoples names for just asking questions. does not explain, skips over some examples and makes you go watch the videos. goes over the lecture notes way too fast, and does not like students asking questions; was about to close the chat for the whole semester.

She is extremely organized & efficient. Her midterms are tough , but fair. To do well in the class, you must put in the time and effort to rewrite lecture notes, thoroughly understand the weekly homework (solutions always posted after deadline), and do the provided extra problems. The final exam is a grade saver! Textbook only needed for hw q's.

She may be intimidating to approach, but very helpful once you visit her office hours.. and trust me, you'll need it. VERY tough class, HARD exams, doesn't scale. Not recommended unless you have a solid understanding of calculus.
SO HARD. Although she is very passionate about math and teaching she will not properly prepare you for the midterm/finals, they are way too hard.

She teaches the subject. But she'll never prepare you for the midterms or exams. Text question are useless. Compare her exams to any other teacher, she basically expects her students to be Calculus Genuises and then Doesnt scale. I self taught myself Math 154. I really struggled to get a decent grade in her class. Proceed with Caution!

So far my favourite prof at SFU. She is very willing to help and encourages questions. She doesn't tolerate tardiness or disruptions. For the most part, the midterms and final were extremely long and almost impossible to finish, but all questions were fair as long as you know the theory, not just the examples.
excellent prof, the only reason I aced calculus!!

She's definitely a character. Her marking scheme is so bizzarre you don't even know how she comes up with your final mark, for good or worst. I had her twice and the first time I should have had a higher mark and the second time I got the mark I deserved. She's really just highly unpredictable, the final was killer, but midterms were easy.

very helpful prof if you need her at anytime! tho very intimidating when helping you!her exams are very difficult. the final exam had many word problems which werent covered during lectures nor on hwk questions. midterms were fair. i enjoyed her class. she is very condsiderate!!
She is AWESOME!!! Made me ...enjoy... calculus. Very, very, very helpful, very sweet. The best prof in math department!!! If you can take anything with her, go for it. You won't regret it.

Excellent notes. She has passion for this course when she is teaching it. If you ask a question and it seems that she is yelling at you... I dont think she means it. Oh... and make sure you come to class. She actually keeps tabs on people she sees and if she catches you in tutorial she will lecture you on coming to class.

Made calculus tolerable. Lovely notes- hand-written, but legible & posted well ahead of time on WebCT. Helpful all the time, friendly most of the time (but everyone has their bad moods sometimes), and usu. present in workshop. Encouraged class when we did well, which was a morale booster. Helped students on final, but ya didn't hear that from me ;)

in the 5 semesters that i've been at sfu shes the best prof that i've ever had!!! her notes are awesome and you can tell she just has a love for teaching and real will to see her students succeed. shes always willing to take extra time out of the schedule to help out students and just knows her stuff. the best at making complicated concept a breeze

yeah....she's good.  She can be intimidating sometimes wen students ask questions becuz her voiice goes too loud.  I think that's just how her voice is.  It has nothing to do wif her annoyance towards da student's question.  She certainly cares for her students and will do her best to hlep.

Best teacher ever. She is really in touch with her class and has an incredible ability to teach her students. She certainly enjoys teaching and that's very encouraging. Her classes are never boring because she always finds something interesting to do. She is an amazing teacher and if I had her for all my courses, then SFU would have been a breathe.

Super passionate about math, and very caring & helpful if you have any questions!

Happy Retirement Dr. J!
